intro: Osmanthus aquifolium var. aureovariegatus, commonly known as the golden-leaved holly-osmanthus, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its striking variegated foliage, with leaves that display a mix of yellow, white, and green hues. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in the spring, which are followed by orange-red berries in the autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its unique leaf patterns and seasonal color changes make it a visually appealing addition to landscapes.
